summary: This document is an email chain from June 13-14, 2019, between federal prosecutors discussing a draft indictment against Jeffrey Epstein. The prosecutors debate the level of detail to include, balancing the need to instill public confidence and provide material for a press conference against protecting victims and preserving investigative details.

persons.name: Geoff
persons.context: Mentioned as the person who would need material to work with at a press conference regarding the Epstein indictment.

events.title: Draft Indictment Circulation
events.description: A draft indictment against Jeffrey Epstein is circulated among prosecutors for review.

events.title: Prosecutorial Strategy Discussion
events.description: Prosecutors discuss the strategy for the indictment, debating the level of factual detail to include to balance public confidence and victim protection.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: A draft indictment against Jeffrey Epstein was being prepared by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York in June 2019.
Prosecutors were actively debating the indictment's content, specifically how much factual detail to include.
Key considerations included instilling public confidence in the case's significance, providing material for a press conference (for 'Geoff'), and protecting victims, especially anonymous ones.
The correspondence indicates an awareness of the case's 'prior history' and a strategic effort to manage public perception.
The document is an internal email chain showing prosecutorial deliberation shortly before Epstein's July 2019 arrest.
